result.execSummary:
The defendant Brennen Juarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Use Of Telephone (Threats), a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).
  • Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Comply with random UA's.
Complete a mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment.
Complete a 500 word essay on how behavior effected the victim.
Complete a cognitive intervention programming.
Maintain full time work or school or combination of both.

No use or possession of firearms.
No contact with K.G. and H.M.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court sets restitution at zero.
Court grants expungement upon successful completion of sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brennen Juarez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brennen Juarez in court.  Attorney Scott Alan Wales Aty in court for Brennen Juarez.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1 of amended information.  
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 2 of amended information. 

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, with credit for 5 DAYS time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 1 YEAR.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 1 YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- Court stayed 30 days condition time in the House of Correction to be used at the discretion of the agent. 
- Maintain absolute sobriety; comply with random UAs.
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both. 
- Complete a mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- No use or possession of firearms.
- Complete 120 hours of community service. 
- NO CONTACT with K.G. and H.M.
- Complete a 500 word essay on how behavior effected the victim.
- Complete a cognitive intervention programming. 

- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
- Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court sets restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court GRANTS expungement upon successful completion of sentence.
Received and Filed.
Jury instructions for plea hearing; Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.
Character Letters; Received and Filed.

Defendant Brennen Juarez in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales. Adam Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.

Defendant previously posted $5,000 cash bail. Court orders $1,000 cash bail remain and $4,000 cash bail is returned to the remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Court ordered no contact with HNM or KAG.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Brennen Juarez in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales. Adam Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
